protocol_name: Carbon isotope discrimination - part II - gas analysis - v.01
protocol_name_html: Carbon isotope discrimination - part II - gas analysis - v.01
description:
Protocol for measurement of carbon isotope descrimination during photosynthesis.

 

See the following references for more background:

H. Griffiths (1993) Photosynthesis and Production in a Changing Environment pp 181-1927

Farquhar et al.  (1989) Annu. Rev. Plant Physiol. Plant Mol. Bioi. 1989. 40:503-37
status_info: We are still developing and optimizing this protocol

source_data.description: Open inlet valve to vacuum (RL)

components.data: Switch between Ref and Sample (2x F1) Reference gas
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Switch between Ref and Sample (2x F1) Reference gas

components.data: Manually open valve and fill the reference loop with gas
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Manually open valve and fill the reference loop with gas

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 6 of Carbon isotope discrimination measurement
source_data.protocol_name: Carbon isotope discrimination - part II - gas analysis - v.01
source_data.protocol_name_html: Carbon isotope discrimination - part II - gas analysis - v.01
source_data.annotation: Make sure the second valve (top of image) is closed so gas only fills the reference loop. Open the first valve (depicted) for ~5s to fill collection loop.
source_data.thread_text: Make sure the second valve (top of image) is closed so gas only fills the reference loop. Open the first valve (depicted) for ~5s to fill collection loop.
source_data.body: Make sure the second valve (top of image) is closed so gas only fills the reference loop. Open the first valve (depicted) for ~5s to fill collection loop.

components.data: Close the valve to the reference gas
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Close the valve to the reference gas

components.data: Open the second valve, to let the reference gas from the connector piece into the inlet
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Open the second valve, to let the reference gas from the connector piece into the inlet

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 8 of Carbon isotope discrimination measurement
source_data.protocol_name: Carbon isotope discrimination - part II - gas analysis - v.01
source_data.protocol_name_html: Carbon isotope discrimination - part II - gas analysis - v.01
source_data.annotation: Make sure the first valve is closed, then open up the second valve (depicted) to let reference gas out of collection loop into the mass spec. You should see a change in the beam intensity as gas is detected. Wait until this stabilizes so all the gas has left the loop.
source_data.thread_text: Make sure the first valve is closed, then open up the second valve (depicted) to let reference gas out of collection loop into the mass spec. You should see a change in the beam intensity as gas is detected. Wait until this stabilizes so all the gas has left the loop.
source_data.body: Make sure the first valve is closed, then open up the second valve (depicted) to let reference gas out of collection loop into the mass spec. You should see a change in the beam intensity as gas is detected. Wait until this stabilizes so all the gas has left the loop.

source_data.description: Repeat steps 6-9 two times

components.data:
Check Beam 1

Look at the beam intensity, it should be =< ~ 1e-12. You should expect a value of around 5e-9
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Check Beam 1

Look at the beam intensity, it should be =< ~ 1e-12. You should expect a value of around 5e-9

components.data: V, then B : set target to 6e-9 (Enter)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: V, then B : set target to 6e-9 (Enter)

source_data.protocol_name: Carbon isotope discrimination - part II - gas analysis - v.01
source_data.protocol_name_html: Carbon isotope discrimination - part II - gas analysis - v.01
source_data.annotation: This is to minimize the possibility of adding technical artifacts to measurements by always analysing gas at ~ the same concentration
source_data.thread_text: This is to minimize the possibility of adding technical artifacts to measurements by always analysing gas at ~ the same concentration
source_data.body: This is to minimize the possibility of adding technical artifacts to measurements by always analysing gas at ~ the same concentration

components.data: Do this for both Sample and Ref side
components.name: Description

components.data: Manually adjust variable volume if the target beam intensity is below or above 6e-9
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Manually adjust variable volume if the target beam intensity is below or above 6e-9

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 16 of Carbon isotope discrimination measurement
source_data.protocol_name: Carbon isotope discrimination - part II - gas analysis - v.01
source_data.protocol_name_html: Carbon isotope discrimination - part II - gas analysis - v.01
source_data.annotation: Take small steps! adjusting the volume +/-5 is sufficient in most cases. The intensity will drfit down over time as gas is consumed by the detector so always good to check both sample and reference immediately before measuring
source_data.thread_text: Take small steps! adjusting the volume +/-5 is sufficient in most cases. The intensity will drfit down over time as gas is consumed by the detector so always good to check both sample and reference immediately before measuring
source_data.body: Take small steps! adjusting the volume +/-5 is sufficient in most cases. The intensity will drfit down over time as gas is consumed by the detector so always good to check both sample and reference immediately before measuring
